titleStmt.title: The regular architect: or the general rule of the five orders of architecture of M. Giacomo Barozzio Da Vignola. With a new addition of Michael Angelo Buonaroti. / Rendred into English from the original Italian, and explained, by John Leeke student and teacher of the mathematicks, for the use and benefit of free masons, carpenters, joyners, carvers, painters, bricklayers, plaisterers: in general for all ingenious persons that are concerned in the famous art of building.
Regola delli cinque ordini d'architettura. English. 1669
titleStmt.author: Vignola, 1507-1573.

titleStmt.title: The regular architect: or the general rule of the five orders of architecture of M. Giacomo Barozzio Da Vignola. With a new addition of Michael Angelo Buonaroti. / Rendred into English from the original Italian, and explained, by John Leeke student and teacher of the mathematicks, for the use and benefit of free masons, carpenters, joyners, carvers, painters, bricklayers, plaisterers: in general for all ingenious persons that are concerned in the famous art of building.
Regola delli cinque ordini d'architettura. English. 1669
titleStmt.author: Vignola, 1507-1573.
Leeke, John.
Michelangelo Buonarroti, 1475-1564.

biblFull.extent: [6] p., 44 leaves of plates : ill., port.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed for Rowland Reynolds, and William Sherwin, and are to be sold at their shops at the Sun and Bible in Postern-street near Moorgate, and next door to the Star in Little Britain,

notesStmt.note: Translation of: Regola delli cinque ordini d'architettura.
Imperfect: faded print with slight loss of text.
Reproduction of the original in the National Library of Scotland.
